Vegan and its effects on breast cancer

  • Vegetarian diets seem to confer protection against cancer.
    • Link to article
    • Cancer epidemiology, biomarkers & prevention : a publication of the American Association for Cancer Research, cosponsored by the American Society of Preventive Oncology. Published February 2013.
  • The study suggests that non vegetarian diet is the important risk factor for Breast Cancer and the risk of Breast Cancer is more in educated women as compared with the illiterate women.
    • Link to article
    • Indian Journal of Community Medicine : Official Publication of Indian Association of Preventive & Social Medicine. Published Apr-Jun 2013.
  • Minority breast cancer survivors were recruited and retained in a weight loss study. Six months of the Curves program resulted in moderate weight loss, but weight loss was not maintained postintervention. Future interventions should identify methods to increase uptake and maintenance of weight loss behaviors.
    • Link to article
    • Obesity. Published 2013/03/16.
  • Although the OmniHeart protein and unsaturated fat diets were superior to the carbohydrate diet in improving CVD risk, all 3 study diets were consistent with national guidelines to reduce chronic disease risk, which suggests that the guidelines might now be fine-tuned to optimize disease prevention. Popular diets vary in their nutritional adequacy and consistency with guidelines for risk reduction.
    • Link to article
    • The American journal of clinical nutrition. Published July 2008.
